definition: Xian Xinghai (1905-1945), violinist and composer, known for patriotic wartime pieces, including Yellow River Oratorio 黃河大合唱|黄河大合唱
surname Xian
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

sentences.english: One of Xian Xinghai's comrades handed him a poem.
sentences.chinese: 冼星海的一個同志遞給他一首詩。

sentences.english: Xian spent his childhood in Singapore and studied in Yangzheng Primary.
sentences.chinese: 冼星海在新加坡度過童年，養正學校是他的母校。

sentences.english: Xian did not stop practicing and soon showed his talents.
sentences.chinese: 冼星海沒有停止練習，不久就顯示出他的天分。

definition: Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Nie Er (1912-1935), musician and composer of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Yellow River Cantata (1939) by Xian Xinghai 冼星海[Xian3 Xing1 hai3]
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Liu Tianhua (1895-1932), Chinese musician and composer
Ouyang Yuqian (1889-1962), Chinese actor
Cao Yu (1910-1997), PRC dramatist

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Yuen Ren Chao (1892-1982), Chinese-American linguist
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
